intro: Buchnera trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed burrweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, triangular-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Buchnera trilobata is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
